items.label: prop-interaction-complexity-bound
items.title: Boundedness of Interaction Complexity Constant
items.content:
291: :label: prop-interaction-complexity-bound
292: 
293: The interaction complexity constant appearing in {prf:ref}`lem-quantitative-kl-bound`, which arises from the KL-divergence evolution equation:
294: 
295: $$
296: |R_N(k)| \leq \frac{C_{\text{int}}}{N}
297: $$
298: 
299: is finite and independent of $N$. Specifically:
300: 
301: $$
302: C_{\text{int}} \leq \lambda \cdot L_{\log \rho_0} \cdot \text{diam}(\Omega)
303: $$
304: 
305: where:
306: - $\lambda$: cloning rate
307: - $L_{\log \rho_0}$: Lipschitz constant of $\log \rho_0$ (the log-density of the mean-field QSD)
308: - $\text{diam}(\Omega)$: effective diameter of the state space

items.label: prop-fourth-moment-baoab
items.title: Fourth-Moment Uniform Bounds for BAOAB
items.content:
746: :label: prop-fourth-moment-baoab
747: 
748: Let $\{Z_k\}_{k \geq 0}$ be the BAOAB chain with step size $\Delta t$ initialized from the continuous-time invariant measure $\nu^{\text{cont}}$. Under the confinement axiom ({prf:ref}`def-confined-potential`), there exists a constant $M_4 < \infty$ independent of $\Delta t$ (for $\Delta t$ sufficiently small) such that:
749: 
750: $$
751: \sup_{k \geq 0} \mathbb{E}_{\nu^{\text{cont}}} [|Z_k|^4] \leq M_4
752: $$

items.label: prop-mixing-rate-relationship
items.title: Relationship Between Continuous and Discrete Mixing Rates
items.content:
2123: :label: prop-mixing-rate-relationship
2124: 
2125: Let $\mathcal{L}$ be a generator with spectral gap $\lambda_1 > 0$ (so the continuous-time semigroup $\mathcal{P}^t = e^{t\mathcal{L}}$ has mixing rate $\kappa_{\text{mix}}^{\text{cont}} = \lambda_1$).
2126: 
2127: For any fixed time step $\tau > 0$, the discrete-time Markov chain with transition kernel $\mathcal{P}^\tau = e^{\tau \mathcal{L}}$ is geometrically ergodic with mixing rate:
2128: 
2129: $$
2130: \kappa_{\text{mix}}^{\text{discrete}}(\tau) = -\frac{1}{\tau} \log(1 - \lambda_1(\tau))
2131: $$
2132: 
2133: where $\lambda_1(\tau) = 1 - e^{-\tau \lambda_1}$ is the spectral gap of the discrete operator $I - \mathcal{P}^\tau$.
2134: 
2135: For small $\tau$, we have:
2136: 
2137: $$
2138: \kappa_{\text{mix}}^{\text{discrete}}(\tau) = \lambda_1 + O(\tau) = \kappa_{\text{mix}}^{\text{cont}} + O(\tau)
2139: $$

items.label: prop-quantitative-explicit-constants
items.title: Explicit Constant Formulas
items.content:
2630: :label: prop-quantitative-explicit-constants
2631: 
2632: Under the framework axioms, the error constants admit the following explicit bounds:
2633: 
2634: **1. Mean-field constant:**
2635: 
2636: $$
2637: C_{\text{MF}} = \sqrt{C_{\text{var}} + C' \cdot C_{\text{int}}}
2638: $$
2639: 
2640: where:
2641: - $C_{\text{var}}$ is the variance constant from the Fournier-Guillin bound for empirical measure fluctuations
2642:   - Depends on metric properties and observable regularity
2643: - $C_{\text{int}}$ is the interaction complexity constant from {prf:ref}`lem-quantitative-kl-bound`
2644:   - Quantifies the strength of particle interactions through the diversity companion probability
2645:   - Explicit form: $C_{\text{int}} = \lambda L_{\log \rho_0} \cdot \text{diam}(\Omega)$
2646:   - Depends on system parameters: $\gamma, \sigma, \lambda, \delta, \beta, \kappa_{\text{conf}}$
2647: - $C'$ is a universal constant from the propagation of chaos proof
2648: 
2649: **2. Discretization constant:**
2650: 
2651: $$
2652: C_{\text{discrete}} = \frac{C_{\text{split}} \cdot C_{\text{poisson}}}{\kappa_{\text{mix}}^{\text{cont}}}
2653: $$
2654: 
2655: where:
2656: - $C_{\text{split}} = \frac{1}{2} \lambda \beta C_{\text{chaos}} \max(C_F, \sigma^2, \|\nabla^2 U\|_\infty)$ (commutator bound)
2657: - $C_{\text{chaos}}$: propagation of chaos constant (Sznitman, typically $O(1)$)
2658: - $C_{\text{poisson}}$: Poisson equation regularity constant (depends on $\gamma, \sigma, \|\nabla^3 U\|_\infty$)
2659: - $\kappa_{\text{mix}}^{\text{cont}} = \min(\kappa_{\text{hypo}}, \lambda)$ (smaller of hypocoercivity gap and cloning rate)
2660: 
2661: **Typical parameter values** (for optimization tasks):
2662: - Friction: $\gamma = 0.1$ to $1.0$
2663: - Noise scale: $\sigma = 0.1$ to $1.0$
2664: - Cloning rate: $\lambda = 0.01$ to $0.1$
2665: - Cloning noise: $\delta = 0.1$ to $0.3$
2666: - Fitness weight: $\beta = 1$ to $10$
2667: 
2668: **Order-of-magnitude estimates:**
2669: - $C_{\text{MF}} \sim O(10)$ for typical problems
